item.title: PROJECT - Looking for Good C# Coder's
item.dc:creator: @anti-mac anti-mac
item.description:
@anti-mac wrote:

frank_:

C# is just ms trying to knock-off java, why else would it compile to CIL rather than machine code

I’m pretty sure all of (or most of) .NET doesnt compile directly to machine code. I really hate that fact though because decompiling is easy then…

Read full topic

item.title: PROJECT - Looking for Good C# Coder's
item.dc:creator: @Silver_Lining Silver Lining
item.description:
@Silver_Lining wrote:

[quote=“anti-mac, post:9, topic:51021”][quote author=Silver Lining link=topic=71484.msg813004#msg813004 date=1169615830]
If those are properly named, the naming conventions on C# are disgusting. Methods starting with a capital? /wrists
[/quote]

Only the ones included with .Net. That’s how they designed it. Don’t blame C# lol…[/quote]Don’t blame it because its more recent editions have methods named horridly? I think I will.

item.title: PROJECT - Looking for Good C# Coder's
item.dc:creator: @anti-mac anti-mac
item.description:
@anti-mac wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:4, topic:51021”]It’s perfectly possible, 1337h4x is a noob.

Silly idea though imo, servers + linux are like bread and butter, do it in something portable.[/quote]

But Java sucks. C# owns.

I’m a C# programmer but I’m much to busy to start a project like this however. Why not try using Microsoft’s Java Language converter and convert a good server like HybridScape (with the permission of the owner of course). If you get you server up and running like HybridScape, I’ll be glad to help you perfect the server.

1337h4x:

Good luck making a java server in C#.

1337h4x:

That’s what I meant.

Right…

Read full topic

item.title: PROJECT - Looking for Good C# Coder's
item.dc:creator: @gander gander
item.description:
@gander wrote:

Server’s, have been taken over by leecher’s and noob’s, there’s no fun in it anymore, I want to change that, I am currently in development of a c# server, I have the socket accepting the connection. All we need to do now is right the ClientHandler. Which would be quite a task, but i’m sure we can do it. I’m looking for half decent coder’s.

Here is a small sample of the source code so far…

[code]
private StreamWriter serverStreamWriter;
private StreamReader serverStreamReader;

int port = 43594;
TcpListener tcpServerListener = new TcpListener(port);
Socket serverSocket = tcpServerListener.AcceptSocket();
tcpServerListener.Start(); //start server[/code]

Yeah, C# is alot like Java. In small doses, it’s also a small piece like VB.

I am looking for developer’s…

You can contact me through MSN or Email at : Gander@runesoft.net.

Also, I never ddosed you guy’s, ddosing is pathetic, Tasty noob is a liar and a scammer. There’s no proof that I DDoSed you.

Read full topic
